explanation:
Reasoning for each symbol (concise):

- OS_TranslatePath: Direct callee of OS_chmod. Any for-loops in this function (or loops in its callees) are part of the executed behaviour reachable from OS_chmod and must be checked for MISRA well-formedness.
- OS_FileChmod_Impl: Direct callee (invoked when translate succeeds). Must be inspected for any for-loops that could violate the rule.
- OS_printf: Called by OS_TranslatePath (per call graph). Although typically a library/logging function, it may contain loops or side effects relevant to clause 2; include to confirm there are no offending for-loops or persistent side-effects used as loop guards.
- OS_strnlen: Called by OS_TranslatePath and may contain iteration over a buffer; its loop implementations must be checked (uses of additional objects, side effects, loop counters, etc.).
- OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch: Called by OS_TranslatePath; could contain for-loops or modify objects used as loop guards — needs review.
- OS_ObjectIndexFromToken: Called by OS_TranslatePath; include because it may contain loops or modify objects relevant to loop-control analysis.
- OS_ObjectIdRelease: Called by OS_TranslatePath; include to ensure any loops or side-effects inside do not violate the rule when invoked from translate path.
- UT_Stub_RegisterReturnType: Listed as a possible callee in the static graph for this path (test harness/stub support). Include because test stubs may be invoked via macros and could contain loops or side-effects that affect analysis.
- UT_Stub_RegisterContextWithMetaData: As above (test harness); include to rule out problematic for-loops or side-effects.
- UT_ExecuteBasicHandler: Test-stub dispatcher that can call user handlers; include because it may execute code with loops as part of the test harness path.
- UT_Stub_GetReturnValuePtr: Test-stub utility present in the graph; include for the same reasons (possible loops/side-effects affecting analysis).
- OS_MAX_LOCAL_PATH_LEN: Macro that sizes the local_path buffer. Needed to reason about any loops that iterate over the buffer (bounds, loop counters, termination conditions) in called functions.
- OS_SUCCESS: Return-code constant used to decide whether OS_FileChmod_Impl is called. Needed to determine control-flow reachability (whether callees with loops are actually reachable).

In short: include the two direct callees and all functions they call (per static graph), plus the test-stub helpers and the constants that affect control flow and buffer sizing. These symbols are necessary to determine whether any for-loops executed as part of OS_chmod (either in OS_chmod itself or inside functions it invokes) are well-formed under the MISRA rule.
